column5: We are doing some planning for our July trip and I have a question. Can we cross the border with frozen minnows? Last year we brought a flat of crawlers from cabellas, with the newspaper etc. Any restrictions on frozen minnows?Thanks,
I would suggest salting the minnows before freezing, not sure how long a plain, frozen minnow would last once it thaws out
if you are going to Saskatchewan check the regs because the have chnged. due to VHS they are starting to ban some baits unless they are caught and processed in saskatchewan.desiel

There is a bait shop just off of I-35 between Mpls & Clouqet that will have them ready if you give them a couple of weeks. Someone on this board recommended them but I don't remember the name. If anyone has it please post because I want to take some this June. Thanks.

This is Fish Lake Bait - www.fishlakebait.com. Phone 651 674 4734.We use them to buy Fatheads every year heading north to Canada. We just turn up without calling and they always have plenty available We bring our own salt and ziplock bags and pack a gallon and half ourselves. Only because one of our guys prefers it that way - I would pay the $2.00 and have them do the salting!Turn at Co Rd 10 off I35.
